__NOTOC__


This website provides links to substantial open-access projects of use to musicians and musicologists. With a burgeoning number of digital resources available, remembering titles of sites and pathways to them can be difficult. Digital Resources in Musicology (DRM) is organized topically and provides a rapid search tool for specialties within heterogeneous collections. Neither the links or their descriptions are exhaustive. Older projects predated the development of the internet are listed at [[ADAM|ADAM: Archive of Digital Applications in Musicology]]. Curated digital and hybrid editions are itemized at [[EVE_%28Electronic_and_Virtual_Editions%29|EVE: Electronic and Virtual Editions]]. Harvard's [http://guides.library.harvard.edu/onmusic/resources Online Resources for Music Scholars] offer a somewhat different, largely complementary mix of projects.
